Online Tamale Store that employs victims of domestic violence. HappyTamale.com

Imelda Happy Tamales is a social enterprise that was established in the year 2014 by Imelda Hartley who is  a domestic violence survivor.We provide employment and services to victims of domestic abuse, by doing this; they are able to transform their lives.

Member of the Alpha Phi Theta  Member of the Student Council. Member of Amnesty International. Leadershape.Modeling for the United Nations.

I facilitated  forums, and developed programs for activities on campus. I was very active in the community and attended Student Public Policy Forum (SPPF) for a short period of time. This program allowed me to gain the tools to effectively advocate for my school, and my community about issues affecting us all. While I attended Amnesty International, I was able to send letters to governors, Presidents and diplomats al over the world to create awareness about the equal rights to trials and the violation of rights on prisoners worldwide. When modeling for the United Nations I was able to participate on real issues affecting the world and allowed me to create resolutions that will bring change. I represented Mexico and other countries. some of the topics i debated were Violence against women in the world; human trafficking; how to empower women in the new created democracy. I did a presentation about violence against women.

I have been a volunteer for Chicanos por La Causa (CPLC) for 8 years. My roles had been many. Receptionist, filling, telemarketing, translation, community partnership for building playgrounds and cleaning up neighborhoods,

She has learned marketing, customer interaction, and how to run a business. I am truly glad I have maintained our relationship.

summary: Imelda Hartley is the CEO of Imelda's Happy Tamales social enterprise. Imelda's Happy Tamales focus is empowering victims of domestic violence. By providing workforce opportunities Imelda's Happy Tamales provides financial freedom that wlps victims become self suficient. By providing education regarding the wheel of power and other educational workshops, Imelda's Happy Tamales helps victims of domestic violence become resilient survivors.Imelda Hartley has been a guest speaker for The National Network of Family Support & Strenghtening Networks. she has been a guest speaker for Entre Mujeres Radio, La 1190 AM, and FrekuenciAlterna Radio. She recently graduated from the Seed Spot Program and she has traveled overseas spreading her message of eliminating domestic violence from our society.
